text:
It seems that whatever is being used to make the tar files for some or all of
the xml.apache.org may be generating bad data. See this bug report for details:

	http://www.NetBSD.org/cgi-bin/query-pr-single.pl?number=18997

The same problem occurs with xalan-j_1_2.tar.gz and xalan-j_2_4_1-bin.tar.gz.
creator: cjs@cynic.net

text:
Well, if nothing else I can tell you that Ant's tar task is used to generate 
our tar distributions.  Perhaps this bug needs to be brought to the attention 
of the Ant developers?
creator: neilg@ca.ibm.com

text:
Moving this report over to Ant since this doesn't seem to be a Xerces problem. 

For the record, Xerces 2.2.1 was built with Ant 1.5.
creator: mrglavas@apache.org
stevel@apache.org
text:
Take a look at the <tar> task documentation and the commentary on how to handle
file paths of >100 characters. Essentially classic unix tar cannot handle such
files and attempts to untar them give an error. We cannot fix all those copies
of tar out there, merely encourage people to use the GNU tar. Marking as invalid
as it is not a defect in ant per-se, merely artifacts of tar format versions. 

Xerces-dev-team; consider the appropriate longfile option in your tar command,
and consider documenting a requirement on using GNU tar for untarring the source
file archives at the very least.
